description:
Build your brand. Tell your story. Take advantage of a rare opportunity to create something new and original.

At Stellantis, we’re breaking with the past and launching a new software organization built from the ground up. The Stellantis Software organization (SWX) was established in 2021 and brings an entirely new vision to the driving experience. Our mission is to design the most captivating experiences in Mobility, bringing “tomorrow’s” tech innovations closer to today, everyday. If you’re ready to help lead this automotive technology transformation, we want to hear from you. Visit https://careers.fcagroup.com/nextgen/ to learn more.

Stellantis was founded in 2021 as the result of a merger between Fiat Chrysler Automobiles and PSA Groupe. For more information, visit: https://www.stellantis.com/en/company/about-us

#remote

The Global Analytics & Data Products Team is building a best-in-class analytics team in support of Stellantis’ Software Group. As the leader of a team of Analysts, Engineers and Micro-Economists, your mission is to partner with the Software Business Management & Growth Team to put science into decision making.

Responsibilities include:
• Create a Business Intelligence discipline that can realize a rapid iteration on business model design
• Design the model by which we partner with engineering and software leaders to identify mission critical questions
• Lead the design of our business curated data models and supporting automation frameworks
• Develop and own centralized, global definitions and business logic for all vehicle and software KPIs and metrics
• Creating a single source of truth for vehicle performance, customer engagement and feature usage data
• Create a single global visualization platform providing both near real-time and batched performance reporting
• Identify data instrumentation needs and work with our data engineering team to ensure successful implementation
• Identify and understand the behaviors of our customers through econometrics research
• Inform and iterate on package and pricing design by building economic models to predict feature demand
• Inform Stellantis’ P&L and associated revenue streams with market sizing forecasts and cost of ownership modeling
• Lead translator, ensuring that insights and recommendations are communicated across disciplines successfully
• Demonstrate exceptional leadership skills in the creation and subsequent development of the new team’s talent

Top Performers will be able to demonstrate:
• Measurable engagement impact through consumer and product reporting, analysis, and statistical models
• Measurable revenue impact through consumer and product reporting, analysis, and statistical models
• Measurable consumer experience impact consumer and product reporting, analysis, and statistical models
• Examples of successfully wrangling non-standardized and unstructured client, middleware, and backend data
• Qualitative and quantitative deductions from experimentation that lead to product optimization
• Measurable efficiencies in tech, tools and agile development adoption and processes
• Proactive leadership leading to a positive impact on their team’s culture

Your Platform

A truly global company, we have headquarters in Amsterdam, Paris, Turin, and Auburn Hills. We also have technology hubs on the east and west coast of the United States, in South America and India. These locations are the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivalled rigor to create the biggest and best automotive experiences in the world.

Our World

Great mobility solutions start with great people! This is an exciting time to join us!

Stellantis is a leading global mobility player guided by a clear mission: to provide freedom of movement for all through distinctive, appealing, affordable, and sustainable mobility solutions. Our Company’s strength lies in the breadth of our iconic brand portfolio, the diversity and passion of our 300,000 people, and our deep roots in the communities in which we operate.

In this new era of mobility, our portfolio of brands is uniquely positioned to offer distinctive and sustainable solutions to meet the evolving needs of customers, as they embrace electrification, connectivity, autonomous driving, and shared ownership. Founded by visionaries who infused them with passion and competitive spirit, these brands have made automotive history for more than a century and continue to speak to customers and inspire our employees today.

The driving force behind us is the diverse and talented group of men and women around the world who bring their passion and experience to their work every day. And while we are a truly global organization, we remain deeply rooted in the communities in which we operate, and our people live and work.

Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related degree field
• A minimum of 10 years of experience, preferably in technology, gaming, entertainment or consumer products
• Comprehensive experience in analytics, data science, consumer insights, visualization platforms
• Experience at performing analyses and ETL using SQL, R, Python, or similar tools
• Comprehensive experience in applied econometrics and statistical inference
• A SQL expert who will put in place code reviews and ensure best practice across the team
• Experience in experimentation design and analysis

Preferred Qualifications:
• Advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Math or related field; Ph.D. preferred

EOE / Disability / Veteran

At Stellantis, we assess candidates based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, age, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and disability. Diverse teams will allow us to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and care for our future.
